item.title: Liquidity Jump, Liquidity Diffusion, and Crypto Wash Trading
item.description: arXiv:2411.05803v2 Announce Type: replace-cross Abstract: We hypothesize that at least a portion of the short-term price jumps in the crypto market are manifestations of liquidity fluctuation caused by wash trading practices. We develop a model to decompose asset liquidity into two components: liquidity jump and liquidity diffusion, which proxy the size and probability of wash trading, respectively. Using the US stock trading data as benchmark, we establish that the combination of high liquidity diffusion and high liquidity jump indicates wash trading, while large-volume trades with high liquidity jump but low liquidity diffusion are actually legitimate trades. The liquidity measures provide a useful tool to all market participants, including researchers, regulators, market makers and investors to understand the interplay between liquidity fluctuation (jump) and liquidity volatility (diffusion), and make appropriate decisions in crypto trading.
item.dc:creator: Qi Deng, Zhong-Guo Zhou
